page.title: 13HEALTH IN THE DOBWALLS AREA
page.content: THE BLOCK IS SERVED MAINLY BY 2 GENERAL PRACTICES, BOTH HAVING THEIR SURGERIES OUTSIDE THE BLOCK, IN LISKEARD. THERE ARE HEALTH VISITORS, DISTRICT NURSES AND COMMUNITY MIDWIVES ATTACHED TO BOTH PRACTICES. THE NEAREST GENERAL HOSPITAL IS IN PLYMOUTH, BUT THERE IS A COTTAGE HOSPITAL IN LISKEARD, TO WHICH HOSPITAL CONSULTANTS COME TO HOLD CLINICS. BABIES ARE BORN AT PLYMOUTH OR TRURO HOSPITALS, A DISTANCE OF 22 OR 30 MILES. A FEW HOME DELIVERIES ARE CARRIED OUT BUT NOT ENCOURAGED, BY THE LOCAL GPs. THERE ARE NO DENTIST SURGERIES OR OPTICIANS OR OSTEOPATHS IN THE BLOCK. A CHIROPODY CLINIC IS HELD WEEKLY FOR THE ELDERLY IN DOBWALLS.
